description: The Prompt Management subsystem is responsible for generating and managing prompts specifically designed for various Large Language Models (LLMs) and interaction styles (bidirectional, unidirectional). It provides the necessary textual context and instructions for the AI Agent Core to perform its tasks effectively. Its boundaries are defined by the `agents.prompts` package.

components.name: Prompt Orchestration Layer
components.description: This component serves as the central entry point for prompt generation. It orchestrates the creation and selection of appropriate LLM-specific prompt factories based on the requested LLM type and interaction style (unidirectional or bidirectional). It also manages the package's public interface and dynamic attribute access, allowing other parts of the system to easily retrieve prompt factories.

components.name: Abstract Prompt Factory Interface
components.description: This component defines the standardized contract and common interface that all concrete prompt factories must adhere to. It provides abstract methods for retrieving various types of prompts (e.g., system messages, analysis messages, feedback messages), ensuring consistency and a unified API across different LLM implementations.

components.name: Unidirectional Prompt Generators
components.description: This component groups the concrete prompt factories responsible for generating prompts specifically designed for GPT, Claude, and Gemini Flash models when a unidirectional interaction style is required. These factories implement the abstract methods defined in `AbstractPromptFactory` to provide LLM-specific prompt templates for one-way communication, such as initial instructions or single-turn queries.

components.name: Bidirectional Prompt Generators
components.description: This component groups the concrete prompt factories responsible for generating prompts specifically designed for Gemini Flash, GPT, and Claude models when a bidirectional interaction style is required. These factories implement the abstract methods defined in `AbstractPromptFactory` to provide LLM-specific prompt templates suitable for conversational or interactive communication, where context and turn-taking are important.
